name: Lobster Recipes - for cooked lobster or crayfish
description: Here are 6 easy recipes for cooked lobster or crayfish that make the most of this luxury seafood! When you buy pre-cooked lobster, it's best to keep it simple to preserve the flavour in the flesh (flavour is better with freshly cooked raw lobster - but much more expensive to buy!).TOP TIP: Keep it simple and don't re-cook lobster that's already cooked (risk of drying out, loss of flavour). Treat it like buckets of cooked whole prawns you peel yourself!Rundown of each recipe in recipe notes below.
recipeIngredient: Seafood Cocktail Sauce ((most intense flavoured, use sparingly))
RecipeTin Family Favourite Seafood Sauce ((my pick!))
Prawn Cocktail recipe - sub prawns with lobster
50g / 3 tbsp  salted butter (, cut into 1.5cm / 1/2" cubes (or unsalted + 1/4 tsp salt))
Lemon wedges & 1/2 cup parsley leaves (, for serving)
Lemon wedges & 1/2 cup parsley leaves (, for serving)
1 cup  (lightly packed) parsley  (, chopped (OK to include some stems, up to 1/4 cup)
2 tsp red or white wine vinegar
160g / 1 cup  cooked lobster meat (, cut into 1cm/ 2/5" cubes (1 x 600g/1.2lb whole lobster))
1 1/2 tbsp green onions (, very finely sliced)
3  mini brioche buns or rolls ((or other very soft roll best for this))
Plain potato chips (, for serving (classic accompaniement))
Garnishes (optional): Pinch paprika, chopped chives, lemon wedges

itemListElement.text: If lobster was frozen, thaw lobster overnight in a bowl or tray (with sides to catch liquid). Drain well before use.
itemListElement.name: If lobster was frozen, thaw lobster overnight in a bowl or tray (with sides to catch liquid). Drain well before use.

itemListElement.text: Cut between head and tail: Insert a small knife at a 45 degree angle into the gap between the tail and head. Cut along the top and sides through to the middle - no need to do underneath.
itemListElement.name: Cut between head and tail: Insert a small knife at a 45 degree angle into the gap between the tail and head. Cut along the top and sides through to the middle - no need to do underneath.

itemListElement.text: Separate head from tail: Twist the tail to separate it from the head. It will pull out meat from the head as well.
itemListElement.name: Separate head from tail: Twist the tail to separate it from the head. It will pull out meat from the head as well.

itemListElement.text: Clean: Scrape or trim off any yellow of black residue on the end that came out of the head.
itemListElement.name: Clean: Scrape or trim off any yellow of black residue on the end that came out of the head.

itemListElement.text: Cut underside: Cut down both sides of the soft shell on the underside of the tail. Then peel it back like a can of sardines to reveal the lobster flesh.
itemListElement.name: Cut underside: Cut down both sides of the soft shell on the underside of the tail. Then peel it back like a can of sardines to reveal the lobster flesh.

itemListElement.text: Remove flesh: Carefully remove the flesh - it should come off the shell cleanly.
itemListElement.name: Remove flesh: Carefully remove the flesh - it should come off the shell cleanly.

itemListElement.text: Remove poop vein - if you see a poop vein (black "string" down the back of the lobster tail meat), then carefully pull it out. If you stretch the meat out straight, you should be able to pull it out in one go. Otherwise, pick it out when you slice it. (Sometimes poop vein is thick, sometimes barely there!)
itemListElement.name: Remove poop vein - if you see a poop vein (black "string" down the back of the lobster tail meat), then carefully pull it out. If you stretch the meat out straight, you should be able to pull it out in one go. Otherwise, pick it out when you slice it. (Sometimes poop vein is thick, sometimes barely there!)

itemListElement.text: Residual meat in head: There will be some residual meat in the head that can be used. The yellow "mustard" (called tomalley) has very intense lobstar flavour but is an acquired taste... I do not eat it!
itemListElement.name: Residual meat in head: There will be some residual meat in the head that can be used. The yellow "mustard" (called tomalley) has very intense lobstar flavour but is an acquired taste... I do not eat it!

itemListElement.text: How to serve: Lobster tail meat can be served whole, sliced into thick or thin pieces or diced, depending on use. I do not recommend shredded as it loses juiciness.
itemListElement.name: How to serve: Lobster tail meat can be served whole, sliced into thick or thin pieces or diced, depending on use. I do not recommend shredded as it loses juiciness.

itemListElement.text: Make Sauce per the Dipping Sauces recipe.
itemListElement.name: Make Sauce per the Dipping Sauces recipe.

itemListElement.text: Serve alongside lobster for dipping. Either cut the lobster into bite size pieces, or serve whole for people to cut themselves. Plate it up individually or on a share platter.
itemListElement.name: Serve alongside lobster for dipping. Either cut the lobster into bite size pieces, or serve whole for people to cut themselves. Plate it up individually or on a share platter.

itemListElement.text: Make the Prawn Cocktail recipe but substitute prawn for lobster cut into small bite size pieces.
itemListElement.name: Make the Prawn Cocktail recipe but substitute prawn for lobster cut into small bite size pieces.

itemListElement.text: Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Once foamy, add garlic and cook until light golden. Remove from stove, add lemon juice and parsley.
itemListElement.name: Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Once foamy, add garlic and cook until light golden. Remove from stove, add lemon juice and parsley.

itemListElement.text: Serving: Pour into serving bowl and serve alongside lobster. Garnish with parsley leaves and lemon wedges.
itemListElement.name: Serving: Pour into serving bowl and serve alongside lobster. Garnish with parsley leaves and lemon wedges.

itemListElement.text: Eating: Let people either dip in bite size pieces or drizzle over lobster, plated up indivudually or on a share style plate. Mop plate clean with crusty bread!
itemListElement.name: Eating: Let people either dip in bite size pieces or drizzle over lobster, plated up indivudually or on a share style plate. Mop plate clean with crusty bread!

recipeInstructions.name: Lobster with Lemon Browned Butter Sauce

itemListElement.text: Make the sauce per the Lemon Browned Butter Sauce recipe.
itemListElement.name: Make the sauce per the Lemon Browned Butter Sauce recipe.

itemListElement.text: Slice the lobster into bite size pieces. Pile onto plate or arrange on indivudual plates. Sprinkle with salt (necessary as browned butter is unsalted).
itemListElement.name: Slice the lobster into bite size pieces. Pile onto plate or arrange on indivudual plates. Sprinkle with salt (necessary as browned butter is unsalted).

itemListElement.text: Serving: Drizzle with some browned butter, then serve more on the side. Garnish with parsley leaves and lemon wedges.
itemListElement.name: Serving: Drizzle with some browned butter, then serve more on the side. Garnish with parsley leaves and lemon wedges.

itemListElement.text: Eating: To eat, dip or drizzle lobster with more browned butter. Mop plate clean with crusty bread!
itemListElement.name: Eating: To eat, dip or drizzle lobster with more browned butter. Mop plate clean with crusty bread!

itemListElement.text: Blitz ingredients in a Nutribullet or small food processor until it becomes a paste. It should be smooth but a bit of courseness for texture ie don't blend into a smoothie.
itemListElement.name: Blitz ingredients in a Nutribullet or small food processor until it becomes a paste. It should be smooth but a bit of courseness for texture ie don't blend into a smoothie.

itemListElement.text: Slice lobster into bite size pieces. Arrange on indvidual plates or share plate. Drizzle little dollops of salsa verde over lobster - don't go overboard, the flavour is quite strong!
itemListElement.name: Slice lobster into bite size pieces. Arrange on indvidual plates or share plate. Drizzle little dollops of salsa verde over lobster - don't go overboard, the flavour is quite strong!

itemListElement.text: Garnish with lemon wedges & parlsey leaves, serve.
itemListElement.name: Garnish with lemon wedges & parlsey leaves, serve.

itemListElement.text: Place lobster in a bowl. Add mayonnaise, lemon, chives, celery, green onions, salt and pepper. Gently toss to coat.
itemListElement.name: Place lobster in a bowl. Add mayonnaise, lemon, chives, celery, green onions, salt and pepper. Gently toss to coat.

itemListElement.text: Split then generously butter buns or rolls. Stuff generously! Makes 2 mini brioche buns or 3 round rolls.
itemListElement.name: Split then generously butter buns or rolls. Stuff generously! Makes 2 mini brioche buns or 3 round rolls.

review.reviewBody: Good info, BUT, the green tomally is actually the liver of either lobster or crayfish, and is exceptional in taste! The only liver I will eat! Not a true lobster/crayfish connoisseur, if one has never tried it warm, or the red roe is a delicacy also. Same taste as sucking the head of a prawn, it's liver.I have your book-great! Cheers!

taking advantage of the sudden appearance of cheap WA crays at Harris Farm, found your instructions on how to get the flesh out simple and effective. Thank you. On perusing the rest of your site, I can see that your knowledge and enthusiasm will have me returning frequently. Thanks for your efforts! Give Dozer an extra pat.
Thank you for your recipes Nagi we all loved your family dressing on our prawns.  I was looking for your post on cooking live lobster but cant find it now

keywords: cooked lobster recipes, crayfish, lobster recipes
